title: Font ID: Cursive/Handwriting Font
content:
Thanks in advance for any help on this. I'm stuck with the logo (although I like it) for a charity fundraising event for our local homeless shelter and I'd like to stick with the same font for some additional text on the invitations, flyers, etc.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141230010921im_/http:/typophile.com/files/choctealogo_sm_4328.jpg)
author: JayhawkAnne

comments.content: Looks like the work of Jill Bell (see [Swank](http://web.archive.org/web/20141230010921/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/creative_alliance/swank/)) but I haven't seen this one.

My first imulse was to say 'hand-drawn', but on closer inspection it could certainly be an OpenType font with alternate endings. I agree this style is like Jill Bell's work, but Ronna Penner (Typadelic) also has this feel at times in her fonts. In fact, it somewhat resembles her [Black Jack](http://web.archive.org/web/20141230010921/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typadelic/black-jack/), which is a free font.

- Mike Yanega

Thank you so much. I agree it looks a lot like Black Jack. I also found a font with similar characteristics called Liorah [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/liorah/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141230010921/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/liorah/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/liorah/") that looks like it might work if I squish it a bit. Thanks to all!
